License.definition: a right or permission granted by a competent authority
License.origin: [Anglo-French, literally, permission, from Old French, from Latin licentia , from licent- licens , present participle of licÄ“re to be permitted, be for sale]

1 a.definition: a right or permission granted by a competent authority (as of a government or a business) to engage in some business or occupation, do some act, or engage in some transaction which would be unlawful without such right or permissiona document, plate, or tag evidencing a license granted

sub_terms.b: revocable authority or permission given solely to one having no possessory rights in a tract of land to do something on that land which would otherwise be unlawful or a trespass compare,
sub_terms.c: a grant by the holder of a copyright or patent to another of any of the rights embodied in the copyright or patent short of an assignment of all rights

2.definition: to permit or authorize by a license

3 a.definition: freedom that allows or is used with irresponsibility

sub_terms.b: disregard for standards of personal conductlicentiousnessvt
